alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Hardin; Larue (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 9:39PM EDT until August 01 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT/1145 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hardin and Larue. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CDT /1145 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 PM CDT /939 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Leitchfield, Hodgenville, Clarkson, Upton, Sonora, Harcourt, Flint Hill, White Mills and Star Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
